choices.C: The STUDENT table is updated with the record: 113 : Jannet : jannet@uni.com and the program prints: 113 : Jannet : jannet@uni.com
choices.B: The STUDENT table is updated with the record: 113 : Jannet : jannet@uni.com and the program prints: 114 : John : john@uni.com
choices.D: A SQLException is thrown at run time.
choices.A: The STUDENT table is not updated and the program prints: 114 : John : john@uni.com

discussion.content: Answer is D, because the correct way to insert a row is rs.insertRow(). Calling updateRow() at the insertion row throws SQL exception

movetoInsertRow() moves position to "next row when record can be inserted". So it looks that content is inserted after row "114". refresh() is called after updateRow(). It is ok inserted content is not lost. C in my opinion.

This method cannot be called when the cursor is on the insert row.
for rs.moveToInsertRow(); Ok

D because called refresh() before calling rs.insertRow() so updates in insert row lost (can someone confirm this please???)
Also, if moveToInsertRow() removed, and called rs.updateRow() at the end, then answer would be C???

choices.B: it executes SQL statements against the database.
choices.C: It only queries metadata of the database.
choices.D: it is written by different vendors for their specific database.

questions.question_text:
DriverManager class?
Which statement is true about the
Connection.
questions.answer_description:
The DriverManager returns an instance of Doctrine\DBAL\Connection which is a wrapper around the underlying driver connection (which is often a
PDO instance).
Reference: http://doctrine-dbal.readthedocs.org/en/latest/reference/configuration.html

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct. The DriverManager returns an instance of Doctrine\DBAL\Connection which is a wrapper around the underlying driver connection.
